issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Many InvalidStateTransitonException errors for ApplicationImpl in Node Manager

comments.body: Devaraj, I see you picked up this ticket.  Have you root-caused these invalid state transitions?  We hit the INIT_CONTAINER at FINISHED one recently, and it appears to be caused when log aggregation fails to initialize for an application.  I'm curious if that's the same root-cause for these, or if there's another failure mode (and therefore I should file a separate JIRA to fix the log aggregation issue).
Deveraj,  We are trying to get this fixed for 0.23.7, hope you do not mind me taking this ticket.

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks for taking a crack at this, Rob.  I see that this takes a slightly different angle at the problem such that failure to initialize log aggregation will no longer fail containers but rather allow them to run without having any logs for them.  IMO that's fine, as logs can also be lost when the NM simply can't access the NN for some reason after a container/app finishes.  Log aggregation as it is today is best effort and not guaranteed.

Some comments on the code:

* AppLogInitFailTransition isn't referenced.
* Nit: some long lines, would be nice if they were reformatted to fit in 80 chars
Jason: Thanks for the review, I have reformatted to 80 columns and correct the transition from INITING via  APPLICATION_LOG_HANDLING_FAILED to call the AppLogInitFailTransition.
